abstract_summ: Methods: Lung ultrasound was performed to 63 patients with COVID-19 pneumonia admitted to a University Hospital.Objectives: The aim is to systematically describe the findings of lung ultrasound in patients with COVID-19 pneumonia and to analyze its prognostic value.CONCLUSION When integrated with clinical data, LUS could represent a valid diagnostic aid in patients with suspect COVID-19 pneumonia, which reflects CT findings.MLUS scores (Z=2.61, P=0.009) and HRCT Warrick scores (Z=2.63, P=0.009) of five severe or critical COVID-19 patients significantly decreased as their conditions improved after treatment.RESULTS All participants had CT findings suggestive of bilateral COVID-19 pneumonia, with an average visual scoring of 43 ± 24%.
title_summ: Lung ultrasound and computed tomographic findings in pregnant woman with COVID-19.Lung Ultrasound in COVID-19 Pneumonia: Correlations with Chest CT on Hospital admission.[Application of pulmonary ultrasound in the diagnosis of COVID-19 pneumonia in neonates].Findings and prognostic value of lung ultrasound in COVID-19 pneumoniaA link between inflammatory biomarkers and lung ultrasound observations in patients with SARS-CoV-2 infectionUse of lung ultrasound to differentiate COVID-19 pneumonia from community-acquired pneumoniaLung Ultrasound in Children with COVID-19: Preliminary Findings
title_abstract_phrases: Methods: Lung ultrasound was performed to 63 patients with COVID-19 pneumonia admitted to a University Hospital.The prognostic capacity of LUSS12 does not surpass that of LUSS8.Use of lung ultrasound to differentiate COVID-19 pneumonia from community-acquired pneumoniaTo investigate the feasibility of lung ultrasound in evaluating coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and distinguish the sonographic features between COVID-19 and community-acquired pneumonia (CAP), a total of 12 COVID-19 patients and 20 CAP patients were selected and underwent the lung ultrasound.CONCLUSION When integrated with clinical data, LUS could represent a valid diagnostic aid in patients with suspect COVID-19 pneumonia, which reflects CT findings.[Application of pulmonary ultrasound in the diagnosis of COVID-19 pneumonia in neonates].Objective: To investigate the application of pulmonary ultrasound in the diagnosis of neonatal COVID-19.RESULTS All participants had CT findings suggestive of bilateral COVID-19 pneumonia, with an average visual scoring of 43 ± 24%.Lung Ultrasound in COVID-19 Pneumonia: Correlations with Chest CT on Hospital admission.
